Sales stalling?
Doing all the things – but nothing’s sticking?
Feeling like it shouldn’t be this hard to grow your HR consultancy business?

What our members want
✅ A clear strategy (no more winging it)
✅ Consistent clients, not up-and-down months
✅ Tools they can use right now
✅ Support from people who get it and care – and who have built multiple HR businesses, not just one!

Why we limit each cohort to 10 people
Because we go deep with every one of them:

We get crystal clear on where and how to find your ideal clients.

We teach strategic account management to grow contracts and profit.

We coach you to network in a way that lands business, not just likes.

We provide the tools, templates, and systems to keep selling long after the cohort ends – and work with you to embed them in the right way for your business.

This isn’t a 10-week sprint that’s forgotten in a nano-second. It’s a business foundation you build once and use again and again. I share all the tools I’ve used to start up, then move to scale up!

Real feedback from this year’s members
💬 “From $2.5K to $7.5K – and the client said YES.”
💬 “Landed a $40,000 contract. I finally believe I can do this.”
💬 “I’ve stopped building in isolation and started selling.”

That’s what happens when you have the right strategy, tools, and people around you.

We stay in your corner
When we wrapped our May cohort last week, I felt it. We don’t just wave goodbye. We stay in touch. We stay in your corner. We want you to take our systems and make them your own. After all, it’s your business, your way. I believe that with my whole heart. I don’t want anyone to feel like they’re going through a cookie-cutter process. That’s the whole point.

How I sold a $75K coaching programme and why charging hourly would have cost them millions

Here’s the scoop
We were working with an executive who was part of a leadership team where 70% of the members were brand new. What started as executive coaching for the CEO quickly revealed a deeper issue:

The leadership team was in chaos

Friction between the CFO and CRO was rising

Milestones were slipping

A $12 M revenue target was floating off into the abyss

That meant a projected $3 M gap if things did not change—and fast.

Hourly pricing versus value pricing
I could have charged hourly. That would probably have totaled around $30 K–$40 K but it would have completely devalued the real transformation they needed:

Team coaching across the board

Live observation of key meetings

Monthly one-on-one coaching for each executive

Real metrics, real measurement, real accountability

This was not a time-for-cash job. It was systemic change at the core of the business. So we priced the value, not the hours.

The result
The adrenaline is still alive and kicking whenever I quote big numbers! We set the price at $75 K—and they said yes. Why? Because the cost of not solving it was $3 M.

A reminder for HR consultants and executive coaches

You are not a cost centre

You are a strategic investment

Your work is invaluable and has real impact

Ready to move from hourly to value-based pricing?
DM me and let’s build your next $75 K package. 🥰

Sell your worth!

We hear it all the time.
But what does that actually mean when it comes to pricing your HR or executive coaching services? Especially if you’ve just left corporate and you haven’t got a Scooby where to start.

Let me break it down for you in a few posts this week.

Step 1: Map out every element of your service
And I mean ALL of it!

The research

Your thinking time

The chats with other consultants (think about those corridor conversations back in your corporate days)

Internal comms and strategy building

Day-to-day client comms – emails, calls, “can you just …”

Execution and delivery

Measuring progress and reporting back

Managing the client, the plan, the people, and the outcomes

Admin. All. The. Admin.

Stakeholder wrangling (obviously)

Step 2: Add 30%
That’s your new baseline – it covers all the small day-to-day tasks that slip into client management and the eleventy-billion “can you just …” requests. What feels simple to you took years to master.

Now look at your hourly rate. If it was $175 when you started, bump it up to $195. See the difference? (By the way, I’d love for you to bet on $250 an hour!)

Step 3: Evaluate the outcome
Does that price reflect the actual value your client will receive? Consider:

Efficiency

Retention

Revenue

Peace of mind

Less grey hair, more sleep at night!

If it doesn’t match, adjust accordingly.

For today:
Start by writing everything out. You’ll be amazed at what you’ve been undercharging for.

Tomorrow I’ll dig into how to think about outcomes and make sure your pricing matches the real impact you bring.

HR Consultant Survival Quiz (bit of fun for today!)

Give yourself 1 point for every YES

You’re juggling 4 retainers and still doing the admin

Your lead-gen strategy equals hoping someone refers you

You’ve said “I’ll sort the backend out next month” (every month)

You built your onboarding in Google Docs and crossed your fingers

You’ve done client work from your car, a café, or your kid’s football match

Your Score
🟢 0–1 (green): Wowzers, you’ve got it 150% sussed, hats off to you!

🟡 2–3 (yellow): Danger zone, your systems are creaking

🔴 4–5 (red): You are exactly why I do what I do to help brilliant HR consultants build a business that actually works for them

I spent a solid 18 months sitting at a 4. It was exhausting and I second-guessed everything. At one point I even wondered if I should go back to corporate.

Then I invested in a coach. I spent a lot of money at the time. That investment has really paid off. Years later I felt humbled when they came to me for coaching.

That experience changed everything. It helped me build multiple 6-, 7-, and even 8-figure HR consultancies. (Not a retail business though – I’d be wildly average at that 😂)

What I’ve learned that still guides me today
✅ Self-awareness over busy-ness
✅ Reflection

July and August energy can feel weird, right?

Half your clients are out of office.
The other half are saying “Let’s talk in the Fall.”
And you? You’re somewhere in the middle of all of that—juggling family and eating right to set yourself up for an awesome Q4.

Here’s what I know after building and coaching multiple HR businesses to six- and seven-figures
August is when a lot of people go quiet

It’s also the month that sets up your entire Q4

In my latest newsletter you’ll get:
Reset your mindset without guilt

Lock in September leads gently but strategically

A clear focus for the rest of this month and heading into August so you’re not scrambling when September hits

Plus you’ll find:

A cheeky little DM strategy to reconnect with leads

Upcoming events (Dallas + NYC, I see you!)

Kelly Swingler’s brilliant Burnout 101 session

Ready to finish 2025 strong?
I’ve included two ways to work with me if you’re ready to move from coasting to consciously creating.

Not with hustle, but with clarity, systems, and intention.

Add the word AUGUST in the comments below if you want help figuring out your best next step—no pitch, just support.

Let’s make this month count without the hustle.

Sam x

“I don’t have time.”

I used to say that a lot, and I missed out on so much. I told myself:

“If I don’t work, I won’t earn.”

“I’ll catch up with that friend next week.”

“I’ll rest later.”

What I did not realize back then was that this all came from a scarcity mindset.

A hard lesson
Years ago, I lost a partner suddenly. That loss reminded me the hard way that for some people, tomorrow never comes. There are still days when I want to hide and tell myself I’m too busy to go out, call someone, or take a break. But I do not want my gravestone to read, “I wish I made more time.”

A moment that stuck with me
One of my aunt’s closest friends, a wildly successful businesswoman, once told me:

“Every time a plane takes off, I pause. I’m grateful I get to go on another adventure.”

She loved to travel and would take herself off to the most wild and remote places. When she spoke about travel, her whole energy shifted into a childlike joy. Her enthusiasm was infectious.

I carry that moment with me. Every time I catch myself saying “I don’t have time,” I pause, think of her, and it brings a smile to my face.

Your takeaway
If you’re reading this and feeling the rush or the burden of it all, just know that:

You do not need to earn your rest.

You do not need to wait for a crisis to create time.

You get to choose what matters most.

Happy Saturday. Whatever you are doing, I hope it is something that lights you up.

Let’s talk about goals (and why they’re never really just about money.)

Everyone talks about financial goals:
“$250 K.”
“£10 K months.”
“Half a million by next year.”

And sure, numbers matter. But that’s never the real goal, is it?

Real goals behind the numbers
One client wanted to hit $450 K. Her real goal was to close the 19 tabs on her screen and have dinner with her kid twice a week. Ten weeks later she called me to say she finished at 4 pm, had only one tab open, and enjoyed dinner with her child. I still get goosebumps because I knew how much that meant to her.

Another client wanted a spa bathroom.

One dreamed of five family holidays a year.

One just wanted to put her son through college without anxiety as a single mum.

Money is the vehicle. The destination is peace, time, freedom, joy, purpose.

Your turn
What is your “one tab open at 4 pm” moment?

If you don’t know yet, I’d love to help you figure that out. You deserve a life built around what matters. Let’s make sure your business supports that.

Let’s talk pricing, because wow, what a hot topic this is.

Even after 25 years of building businesses, I still get it wrong sometimes. If you’re just starting out on your HR consultancy journey and feel stuck on what to charge, here’s a starting point I often recommend:

Step 1: Set an hourly rate
For your first couple of clients, billing by the hour is fine. It gives you space to build confidence and experience. A good starting range is $150 to $250 per hour, depending on your skillset and comfort level. Let’s use $150 per hour as a benchmark, the lowest point I suggest while you master the art of selling.

Step 2: Calculate what you actually need
If you want to replace a $120,000 salary, divide 120,000 by 150. That equals 800 billable hours per year.

Step 3: Break it down by week
Assuming 48 working weeks, 800 hours divided by 48 equals about 16.7 billable hours per week. That works out to roughly four clients at four to five hours each. Totally doable.

Key reminders
This is just the start of your journey. Once you’ve landed your first few clients, productise and package your services so you are selling value, not time.

If you feel confident doing value-based pricing from the outset, even better. These principles still apply and give you a strong foundation.

Those billable hours do not include admin, marketing, sales time, financial planning, or your own development. Building systems and boundaries early on is key.

Want help creating a revenue plan that does not burn you out? Let’s chat. I coach HR consultants through their first $250,000 and beyond with clarity, confidence, and clients they love.

He clicked his fingers. I cancelled immediately.

I wish I was joking. I was mid-call with a business coach, sun pouring in, feeling hopeful. Then the finger-clicking incident

“Is it £1 m? £6 m? You tell me!”

I nearly choked on my peppermint tea

About me
I am not allergic to ambition. Far from it. I have scaled multiple HR consultancy businesses and built big revenue. I love helping HR consultants dream big on their terms meet, exceed and support them to reach their goals. But I also believe in asking smart questions, not finger-clicking like I’m on Dragon’s Den.

Why I walked away
• Zero commercial logic behind the question
• No real curiosity about my goals
• Finger clicking? No. Just no

I reviewed the contract, sent the email, and noped my way out of that coaching relationship before it could do real damage.

What I believe
• Good coaching pushes you
• Great coaching empowers you with strategy, structure and your own answers
• Brilliant coaching comes with curiosity, systems and never requires jazz hands

Your turn
If you’re an HR pro or consultant who is tired of the noise and wants to build a business that feels aligned, commercially smart and actually yours, I’m here. Finger-free.

What’s the weirdest coaching moment you have ever had? No names, just spill the tea.

Pumpkin spice isn’t the only thing brewing…

It’s that time of year when half of LinkedIn goes quiet, and the other half starts “rebranding their offer” for the 9th time.

But you?

You’re smarter than that.

You remember what it’s like to waste time.
Like that nightmare corporate project where you and Sally [insert other name and scenario here] bonded over the trauma and stale donuts 🍩

(You still friends? Go say hi. She might be your next client.)
She could also introduce you to your next client.

While the world is sipping iced lattes and ghosting their goals…

We’re over here brewing something stronger than espresso:

☕️ Sales calls
☕️ Referral reactivations
☕️ Offers that don’t sound like IKEA instructions

Here’s what we’re doing instead of panicking:

Messaging 3 past dream clients
Not with a pitch. Just a “Hey, how’s business?”

Auditing offers
If it feels clunky to say, it’s clunky to buy.

Following up on the “maybes”
If they didn’t say no, they’re still in play.

Creating content for 2 weeks ahead
So when life hits, you’re still consistent.

Booking September calls now
Future-you wants a high-five.

Because August isn’t dead time for sales. It’s prep time.

Less doomscrolling. More doing.
Less panic. More pipeline.

→ Pumpkin spice isn’t the only thing brewing...

Let’s goooo!

If I had to start again tomorrow and start from scratch again with:

No brand

No clients

Just a laptop and a whole lot of determination, hopes and dreams.

I think this is what I would do now:

Firstly set myself a revenue target to work backwards
$250K Yr1

Step 1: Set up properly
LLC/LTD depending on where I’m based

Internal rate card (day rates, retainers, packages)

Have that as an outline for ME to use during my eleventy billion calls

Step 2: Build my relationship-first pipeline
List 50 people I’ve worked with who:
✔️ Now run their own business
✔️ Own a budget
✔️ Could refer me

Reach out and reconnect. Genuinely, not salesy. I'd connect our conversation with a moment in time we had together that's memorable. I'd also want to then reach out to another 50, and another 50.

Step 3: Track everything
→ Conversations
→ Follow-ups
→ Wins + learnings

I'd just use a simple spreadsheet. In fact, I've been revising the one I have now for almost a decade.

Step 4: Borrow someone else’s stage
→ I’d ask my accountant, broker, employment lawyer:

“What events do you go to?”

“Mind if I tag along?”

It’s amazing what happens when you just ask.

Also, another tip: if I couldn't afford the big conference, I'd get myself to the event and hang out at the bars and hotels to meet attendees.

Step 5: Guardrails. For them and for me.
→ No “always available” mindset (I'm no longer an employee)
→ Clear boundaries
→ Clear offers
→ Clear confidence (even when I’m winging it a bit)

So if you are setting up your first HR consultancy or fractional business, I hope this helps.

Good luck and welcome to an exciting, exhilarating and scary journey all rolled into one.

The strangest place I’ve ever found a client?

A hot tub. Yep, you read that right. Bubbles. Robes. Spa music. The whole shebang.

I was away for the weekend, enjoying a little R&R… and decided to dip into the spa.

There were only a couple of us in there. Naturally, we got chatting (as you do. If you've been to anything in person with me, IFYKYK 🫠).

One thing led to another… and no, this isn’t that kind of story.

It turns out they were an ideal client. Right there, mid-soak.

No business cards. No fancy funnel. Just a good old-fashioned conversation in chlorine.

As soon as I got back to my room, I connected on LinkedIn and hit follow. (Spa hair and all.)

Moral of the story?

You never know where your next client is coming from.

But you do have to be open to the chat and stay curious.

So tell me this…

HR consultants, what’s the strangest or funniest place you’ve ever found a lead?

Bus queue? Zumba class? Kids’ school disco? I want the goods.

Happy Fridayyyyy!!!!

More HR consultants = more competition?
Not really.

Yes, more consultants and coaches are entering the HR space.
Yes, the industry’s growing.
No, that doesn’t have to be scary.

Here’s the thing:
The best HR consultants I know?

They don’t operate in silos.
They collaborate. They refer. They team up.

Why?

You can take on bigger, juicier projects

You’ve got backup when life throws curveballs

You stop trying to do all the things you secretly hate

You stay sane while building a grown-up business that runs without panic

There is plenty of work to go around.

And the people who truly thrive?

Build real relationships

Stop side-eyeing the competition

Choose connection over comparison

Because when you’re confident in what you bring to the table, you’re not scared of someone else pulling up a chair.

If you’re new to the space (or just a bit solo-wobbly), start with this:

Say hi to someone doing great work, even if it makes you sweat a little.

Inside Business Club, our members collaborate all the time.
We’ve even got a buddy system and regular in-person meetups to make sure you never have to build your business alone.

Ready for less lone-wolfing and more win-wins?
DM me “buddy up” and I’ll tell you how to get involved.

Happy Monday everyone, let’s gooooooo!!!!

Some “I’ve made it” posts do more harm than good.
But the real ones?

The ones built on resilience, not smoke and mirrors?

Those are the ones I truly admire. 💛

I’ve worked with HR consultants who landed their first client within days.
Others took a couple of months.
And some? It took 9 to 10 months.

Not one of them did anything wrong.

Because this isn’t a race.
This is business-building.
And the road looks different for everyone.

The ones who took longer?

Their grit, their self-leadership, their ability to keep showing up
even in the middle of:

self-doubt

financial stress

“is this ever going to work?” moments

That’s the kind of success we don’t celebrate enough.
People with true grit.

So if you’re starting out as an HR consultant...

Please don’t compare your chapter one to someone else’s highlight reel.

This is your journey.
Your business.
Your rules.

No one else has your story.
No one else is you.
You do you.

And if you’re in that “it’s taking longer than I thought” phase… you’re not alone.

I see you.
And I’d be honoured to support you.

I’ve Been Set a $68K Challenge And I’m Taking You With Me (Even Though I’m Nervous as Hell)

I've been given a big, bold goal:

"Generate an extra $68K in 90 days" with one of my HR consultancy partners.

And honestly?

It’s exciting.
It’s terrifying.
And it’s stretching every part of me.

I thought about keeping it private.
Nail the strategy. Hit the number.
Then post a shiny “here’s how I did it” recap in 90 days.

But that’s not how I want to lead.

So here it is, messy, real, in-progress:

I’m breaking down my exact plan into a 7-day sprint and sharing it in real-time so you can build your own version alongside me.

This isn’t about being perfect.

I’m not. I’ll mess up, fumble, and probably change my mind once or twice.

But every mistake? It’s just another step forward. Another data point. Another day of momentum.

If you join this sprint, you’ll walk away with one thing:

✅ A clear, sellable service plus a simple system to generate leads for it in 90 days or less.

Not a funnel. Not a “visibility hack.”

Just focused action that moves the needle.

Today (Sunday), my CEO Reset looks like this:

I'll focus on just ONE service to sell

Finalise my lead magnet (I want to create a sense of urgency without the ick)

Build my first 150-contact list (yes, with good old Excel)

And here’s the best part. I’m not doing it alone. I'd love to do it with you.

I’m hosting a live Accountability Sprint Call on Tuesday and you’re invited:

Tuesday (this week)
🕔 5pm UK / Midday EST / 9am PST

We’ll work together to:

Choose YOUR one service

Start YOUR prospect list

Set YOUR 90-day revenue goal (one that excites you, not terrifies you)

You don’t need the perfect offer or branding. I see that as an evolution.

Just the courage to show up and take one step.

And I’ll be right there doing it with you, nerves and all.

Drop a “yes please” below and I’ll DM you the link plus a prep sheet to get started.

Others are already joining. Come be part of something real, imperfect, and powerful.

Let’s build this runway together in June. You in?! ❤️

I am glad so many HR consultants are leaving the world of corporate.

They deserve to be treated way better than they are!

Let's just be clear on something to those corporate leaders who think that your HR is:

- There to buy the team birthday presents.
- Organise the office parties.
- Get you out of the hole that they advised you NOT to get into in the first place.
- Take your calls during family dinners to deal with the above.

Nope!

This is what they CAN do:

- STOP your best people from leaving - for the right reasons.
- Create a culture that encourages your team to work hard.
- Hit and exceed all of your business goals.


So yeah - HR folks - keep leaving' - it's way more fun over here!
